meanings.definition: The scientific study of the effects of freezing temperatures on substances.
meanings.sent1: In cryoscopy, scientists investigate how freezing affects different materials.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician used cryoscopy to understand how cold temperatures impact various elements.
meanings.sent3: During the cryoscopy experiment, the frozen banana turned into a rock-solid popsicle!
meanings.sent4: Her passion for cryoscopy was as deep as the frozen lakes she studied.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of cryoscopy lies in uncovering the secrets hidden within icy realms.

meanings.definition: A method of determining the freezing point of a liquid by observing the depression of its freezing point when a solute is added.
meanings.sent1: The chemist relied on cryoscopy to find out the freezing point of the liquid.
meanings.sent2: Using cryoscopy, the scientist accurately measured the freezing point depression caused by the solute.
meanings.sent3: The cryoscopy test revealed that adding salt to water made it freeze at a lower temperature.
meanings.sent4: Her understanding of cryoscopy was as clear as the ice melting under the sun.
meanings.sent5: Through cryoscopy, the hidden characteristics of liquids are brought to light.
